edu.iu.dsc.tws.comms.dfw.io.reduce.keyed

Class KReduceBatchReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.iu.dsc.tws.comms.dfw.io.KeyedReceiver

    MessageReceiver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    KReduceBatchPartialReceiver

    public abstract class KReduceBatchReceiver
extends KeyedReceiver
    Abstract class that is extended by keyed reduce batch receivers

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected boolean moveMessagesToSendQueue(int target, java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.util.Queue<java.lang.Object>> messagesPerTarget)
      moves all the buffered messages into the sendQueue for the given target, this method assumes that for each target that there is only one object in the queue.
      protected boolean offerMessage(int target, java.lang.Object object)
      The reduce operation overrides the offer method because the reduce operation does not save all the incoming messages, it rather reduces messages with the same key and saves only the reduced values.

      • KReduceBatchReceiver

        public KReduceBatchReceiver()

    • Method Detail

      • offerMessage

        protected boolean offerMessage(int target,
                               java.lang.Object object)
        The reduce operation overrides the offer method because the reduce operation does not save all the incoming messages, it rather reduces messages with the same key and saves only the reduced values. So the messages data structure will only have a single entry for each target, key pair
        Overrides:
        offerMessage in class KeyedReceiver
        Parameters:
        target - target for which the messages are to be added
        object - the message/messages to be added
        Returns:
        true if the message was added or false otherwise

      • moveMessagesToSendQueue

        protected boolean moveMessagesToSendQueue(int target,
                                          java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.util.Queue<java.lang.Object>> messagesPerTarget)
        moves all the buffered messages into the sendQueue for the given target, this method assumes that for each target that there is only one object in the queue. This is required when working with reduce operations
        Overrides:
        moveMessagesToSendQueue in class KeyedReceiver
        Parameters:
        target - target for which the move needs to be done
        messagesPerTarget - messages for given target
        Returns:
        true if the messagesPerTarget is not empty at the end of the moving process or false otherwise
